page.title: 03VILLAGE EVENTS IN GRAFTON
page.content: A number of events are held in the village every year. The Strawberry Fair is held on the school field in July. This is a joint village and school fete with the school sports being held before the stalls open. The stalls include guessing the weight of the lamb and a roller coaster made out of a bale elevator. Also in the summer the villagers have a pig-roast at Fisher's Farm. An actual barn is used for the local barn-dance, and also in the autumn a Halloween Disco is held in the village hall. A number of car-boot and jumble sales take place during the year at the Village Hall to raise money for village activities. When there is a very special occasion everyone in the village gets together and organises a street party. At the School Christmas Fair, Father Christmas pays a visit.
